1. Heat oil in a frying pan. Add the onion, garlic, ginger and spices. Fry for a few minutes until the onions are translucent. Add the tomatoes and cook until they are soft and slightly reduced. Stir in the tomato paste and cook for a further few minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.
2. Bring a large pot of water to boil. Add the basmati rice and cook until al dente (about 10-15 minutes). Drain and set aside.
3. In a large saucepan, heat the remaining oil over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and fry for a few seconds until they start to sizzle. Add the green beans and cook for a few minutes until they are bright green and slightly softened. Add the tomato mixture to the pan along with the rice, coriander leaves and mint leaves. Stir well to combine and heat through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot with yogurt on the side (optional).

- Dry chickpea flour can be substituted with besan flour or any other gram flour. If using besan, it is recommended to sift the flour to ensure there are no lumps. Challah Bread Recipe
рд╕рдорд╛рди рдорд╛рдкрджрдВрдб
рд╢реНрд░реЗрдгреА: рднреЛрдЬрди
рдЯрд╛рдЗрдо: 3 hours
рд░рд╛рд╢рди: 4-6 servings

рд╕рд╛рдордЧреНрд░реА:
3.5 рдХрдк (420 g) рдЪрд╛рд╡рд▓ рдХреЗ рдЖрдЯреЗ, рдЧрд░реНрдо
1.5 рдХрдк (350 ml) рдкрд╛рдиреА, рдЧрд░реНрдо
1/4 рдХрдк (60 ml) рд╡рд┐рдиреЗрдЧрд░, apple cider
2.25 рдХрдк (280 g) bread flour, all-purpose flour can be substituted but bread will be slightly less tender and have a little less rise.
2.5 tsp (14 g) salt
1 tbsp (14 g) sugar or honey
2 tbsp (30 ml) vegetable oil, such as canola or sunflower oil
1 large egg, at room temperature (optional, for a more golden crust)
1/4 cup (60 ml) water (optional, if needed for a softer dough)
Equipment: Stand mixer with dough hook attachment or food processor. If mixing by hand, a large bowl and dough scraper will be needed. A baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat will also be needed for baking the bread.
рдЗрдВрд╕реНрдЯреНрд░рдХреНрд╢рдиреНрд╕:
1. In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook attachment, or in a food processor fitted with the dough blade, add the warm water, vegetable oil, salt, and sugar. Mix until combined. Then add the flour and yeast and mix until a shaggy dough forms. If mixing by hand, combine all the ingredients in a large bowl and knead by hand until the dough is smooth and elastic, about 8-10 minutes. If the dough is too dry, add additional warm water, one tablespoon at a time. If the dough is too wet and sticky, add additional flour, one tablespoon at a time. The finished dough should be soft but not sticky. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let the dough rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about one hour.
2. Punch down the risen dough and transfer it to a lightly floured surface. Divide the dough into three equal portions. Roll each portion into a long rope about 24 inches (60 cm) long. Braid the three ropes together tightly and pinch the ends to seal them together. Transfer the braided loaf to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet or silicone mat-lined baking sheet. Cover the loaf loosely with plastic wrap or a clean kitchen towel and let it rise in a warm place until doubled in size again, about one hour. Preheat the oven to 375┬░F (190┬░C). Brush the top of the risen loaf with the beaten egg (if using) and sprinkle with poppy seeds or sesame seeds if desired. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown and an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of the bread registers at least 190┬░F (88┬░C). Remove from oven and transfer to a wire rack to cool completely before slicing and serving. Enjoy your homemade challah bread!

"April is a great time to be in Okinawa, as it is when the cherry blossoms and other flowers are at their most beautiful. The weather is generally mild and pleasant, and there are many festivals and events happening throughout the month. Here are some things you might want to do during your visit:

Visit the Cherry Blossom Festival: The Okinawa Cherry Blossom Festival takes place in Nago City and features beautiful cherry blossoms, traditional music and dance performances, and food stalls. It usually takes place in early April.

Explore Shuri Castle: Shuri Castle is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and was the former royal palace of the Ryukyu Kingdom. You can learn about the history of Okinawa and admire the beautiful architecture.

Go snorkeling or diving: Okinawa is famous for its clear waters and diverse marine life. You can go snorkeling or diving to see colorful fish, coral reefs, and even sea turtles.

Visit the Churaumi Aquarium: The Churaumi Aquarium is one of the largest aquariums in the world and features a wide variety of marine life, including whale sharks. It's a great place to learn about the ocean and see some amazing creatures up close.

Try local food: Okinawa has its own unique cuisine that is influenced by both Japanese and Chinese flavors. Be sure to try some of the local specialties like goya champuru (a stir-fry with bitter melon), soki soba (noodles with braised pork ribs), and awamori (a type of distilled spirit made from rice).

Attend a festival: There are many festivals happening throughout April in Okinawa, including the Naha Hari Festival (a boat race festival), the Ryukyu Lantern Festival (a lantern festival), and the Ryukyu Kemari Festival (a traditional football game). These are great opportunities to experience local culture and have some fun."

"рдЕрд░рдмреАрдп рдХрд╣рд╛рдиреА" (Black Swan) - рдПрдХ рдЕрддрд┐рдерд┐ рдШрдЯрдирд╛, рдЬрд┐рд╕реЗ рдЖрдкрдХреЗ рдЖрдЧреЗ рдЙрддреНрдкрддреНрддрд┐-рдкрд░рдореНрдкрд░рд╛рдЧрдд (forecast-based) prediction model, statistical approach, financial risk management techniques, etc. will not predict.

рдЙрдЪреНрдЪрддрдо (superior) market capacity - refers to the ability of a market to produce unexpected events, or "Black Swans".

рдирд╕реАрдо рдирд┐рдХреЛрд▓рд╕ рддрд╛рд▓реЗрдм (Nassim Nicholas Taleb) is a Lebanese-American essayist, scholar, statistician and risk analyst whose work concerns problems of randomness, probability and uncertainty. He has been a professor at several universities.

Nassim Nicholas Taleb is a world-renowned author and scholar known for his work in the field of risk management and probability theory. He is particularly well-known for his work on "black swans", which refers to unexpected and highly consequential events that are difficult to predict using traditional statistical models. Taleb has argued that these types of events are more common than we might think, and that they have the potential to shape our world in profound ways. In the context of markets, Taleb has argued that superior market capacity refers to the ability of a market to produce unexpected events or "black swans". This can be seen as an indication of the market's resilience and adaptability, as well as its capacity for innovation and growth. Overall, Taleb's work emphasizes the importance of being prepared for the unexpected and recognizing the role that uncertainty plays in shaping our world.

It is created by breaking down the speech signal into its individual frequencies and plotting their strength over time. MEL-spectrograms are often used in speech recognition and synthesis applications.

On the other hand, MFCCs are a type of feature vector that is used to represent speech signals. They are derived from the MEL-spectrogram by taking the discrete cosine transform (DCT) of the logarithm of the power spectrum, followed by a mel-frequency filtering and finally a non-linear transformation. MFCCs are used in many speech recognition and synthesis applications because they are more robust to noise and channel variations than raw audio signals or MEL-spectrograms.

In summary, MFCCs are a type of feature vector that is derived from the MEL-spectrogram and used in speech recognition and synthesis applications, while MEL-spectrograms are visual representations of the spectral content of speech signals.

Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows is the seventh and final book in the Harry Potter series by J.K. Rowling. The story follows Harry Potter, Ron Weasley, and Hermione Granger as they search for the remaining Horcruxes that contain pieces of Lord Voldemort's soul, in order to destroy him once and for all.

The book begins with the death of Albus Dumbledore, leaving Harry feeling lost and alone. However, he soon discovers that Dumbledore left him with a task - to find and destroy the Horcruxes before Voldemort can find them first. With the help of his friends, Harry sets out on a dangerous journey to find the Horcruxes and defeat Voldemort once and for all.

Throughout their journey, Harry, Ron, and Hermione face many challenges and dangers, including Death Eaters, Snatchers, and even a dragon. They also discover more about their own pasts and families, including the truth about Snape's love for Lily Potter.

The climax of the book takes place at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, where Harry confronts Voldemort in a final battle. With the help of his friends and allies, Harry is able to defeat Voldemort once and for all, bringing an end to his reign of terror.

Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows is a thrilling conclusion to the beloved Harry Potter series. The book is full of action, adventure, and emotional moments that will leave readers on the edge of their seats. The characters continue to grow and develop throughout the story, making it a satisfying conclusion to their journeys.

One of the strengths of the book is its exploration of themes such as love, loss, friendship, and sacrifice. The characters are forced to make difficult choices throughout the story, often putting their own lives on the line for the greater good. This adds depth to the characters and makes them more relatable to readers.

The world-building in this book is also exceptional. Rowling has created a rich and detailed world that feels fully realized and believable. The magical creatures and spells add an element of wonder to the story, while the political intrigue adds complexity to the plot.
Overall, Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows is a must-read for fans of fantasy literature. It is a satisfying conclusion to an epic series that will stay with readers long after they finish reading it.

The KH-11 satellites were developed in the late-1960s and early-1970s, and the first satellite in the series was launched in December of 1976. The program was highly classified, and very little information about the capabilities of the satellites was made public. However, it is believed that the KH-11 satellites had the ability to capture images with a resolution of up to one meter, which was much higher than any other satellite imaging system at the time.

As for their current status, it is not publicly known whether any KH-11 satellites are still in operation today. However, it is believed that the NRO has continued to develop and operate similar reconnaissance satellites under different program names.

In terms of their capabilities, it is likely that any remaining KH-11 satellites or their successors would still have high-resolution imaging capabilities, although they may have been upgraded with newer technology over time. import torch
import torch.nn as nn


class Model(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, input_size, hidden_size, output_size, n_layers):
        super().__init__()
        self.input_size = input_size
        self.hidden_size = hidden_size
        self.output_size = output_size
        self.n_layers = n_layers
        self.linear1 = nn.Linear(input_size, hidden_size)
        self.relu = nn.ReLU()
        self.linear2 = nn.Linear(hidden_size, output_size)
        
    def forward(self, x):
        x = self.linear1(x)
        x = self.relu(x)
        x = self.linear2(x)
        return x

CRISPR/Cas9 system is an RNA-guided genome editing system that targets and edits specific regions of the genome. It is a combination of a guide RNA and an enzyme called Cas9 that can be programmed to target and edit specific regions of the genome.

CRISPR/Cas9 works by first creating a guide RNA that is designed to target a specific sequence of DNA. This guide RNA then binds to the targeted sequence and directs the Cas9 enzyme to cut the DNA at the targeted location. The cell then uses its natural repair mechanisms to fix the break in the DNA, which can result in changes or mutations in the targeted region.

CRISPR/Cas9 has a wide range of potential applications in fields such as medicine and agriculture. For example, it could be used to correct genetic mutations that cause disease or to improve crops by making them more resistant to pests or diseases. However, the technology also raises ethical concerns about its potential misuse or unintended consequences. For example, there are concerns about using CRISPR/Cas9 to edit human embryos or to create "designer babies" with specific traits. Additionally, there are concerns about the potential for unintended mutations or side effects that could arise from using this technology.

In conclusion, CRISPR/Cas9 is a powerful tool for editing genomes and has many potential applications in various fields. However, it is important to carefully consider the ethical implications of using this technology and to ensure that it is used responsibly and for the benefit of society as a whole.

"There are several reasons why space exploration is considered important and has been pursued throughout history. Some of the key reasons include:

Advancing scientific knowledge: Space exploration has led to numerous discoveries and advancements in fields such as astronomy, physics, and biology. For example, the Apollo missions to the Moon helped to advance our understanding of the Moon's geology and history, while the Hubble Space Telescope has provided us with an unprecedented view of the universe and its many wonders.

Expanding human knowledge and experience: Space exploration has allowed us to gain a deeper understanding of our place in the universe and to experience the beauty and vastness of space firsthand. It has also inspired generations of people to pursue careers in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) fields.

Developing new technologies: Space exploration has driven the development of many new technologies that have had wide-ranging applications beyond space exploration. For example, the development of satellite technology has revolutionized communication and navigation, while advances in rocketry have led to new propulsion systems for airplanes and other vehicles.

Inspiring future generations: Space exploration has inspired generations of people to dream big and pursue careers in STEM fields. It has also helped to foster a sense of global cooperation and collaboration, as countries around the world have worked together to achieve common goals in space.

Exploring new frontiers: Space exploration allows us to explore new frontiers and expand our understanding of the universe. It also provides opportunities for future human habitation and colonization of other planets or celestial bodies."

The Tlaxcallans were traditional enemies of the Aztecs. The Aztecs were weakened by an epidemic of smallpox brought to Mexico by Spanish conquistadors. def send_verification_email(email: str) -> None:
    import smtplib
    from email.mime.text import MIMEText

    sender = "from@example.com"
    recipient = email
    subject = "Verify your email address"
    message = f"Hi {recipient},\n\nPlease click on the following link to verify your email address:\n{link}\n\nBest regards,\nThe Example Team"
    text = MIMEText(message, "plain")
    text["Subject"] = subject
    text["From"] = sender
    text["To"] = recipient

    with smtplib.SMTP("smtp.example.com") as server:
        server.sendmail(sender, [recipient], text.as_string())
